      Methods in architecture with parameters of type Drawable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Player.doMove(Drawable[][] pieces)
      Asks the player for a direction to move to, asking until they select an option that is still on the board and not blocked by landscape.
      void Moveable.move(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point playerLocation) 
      private boolean Player.updatePlayerLocation(Drawable[][] pieces, int option)
      Moves the player if the choose a valid direction.

      Methods in pieces with parameters of type Drawable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      InteractionResult Dwarf.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Gives the player a point each interaction up to a certain set number.
      abstract InteractionResult GamePiece.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Abstract method, each piece interacts with the player differently.
      InteractionResult Artifact.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Randomly kills or advances the player if they are at the same location.
      InteractionResult Orc.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Each time the player interacts with the Orc they are injured, but the Orc is also injured.
      InteractionResult Skeleton.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Each interaction injures the Skeleton.
      InteractionResult Elf.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      The Elf ignores everything and gives no interaction.
      InteractionResult Unicorn.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      If the player is on the same location and the Unicorn is on the board, they are healed and get a point.
      InteractionResult Sage.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      If the player has the required number of points, the Sage talks to them.
      InteractionResult Man.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Prints out a message.
      InteractionResult Knight.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Advances the player to the next level if they are on the same space.
      InteractionResult Witch.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Kills the player if they are within one space in either direction of them.
      InteractionResult Dragon.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Only interacts on the same spot.
      InteractionResult Wizard.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      Strikes the player if they are within two spaces in any direction.
      InteractionResult Trap.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      If the player is on a space directly adjacent to the Trap, it activates and HITs them.
      InteractionResult SkeletonKing.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      If the level is clear of Skeletons, the path to the end of the level is cleared.
      InteractionResult Maiden.interact(Drawable[][] pieces, Player player)
      If the player is on the same spot as the Maiden and has not interacted yet, they are healed.
      void Dwarf.move(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point playerLocation)
      Randomly moves the Dwarf left/right or up/down, based off the previous turn.
      void Orc.move(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point playerLocation)
      The Orc moves one space in one direction that it is furthest from the player.
      void Skeleton.move(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point playerLocation)
      The Skeleton randomly moves around a 3x3 grid, the bounds of which are determined by the location it is constructed with.
      void Elf.move(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point playerLocation)
      Randomly moves the Elf one space left, right, up, or down.
      void Unicorn.move(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point playerLocation)
      While the Unicorn does not change location, it is only on the board once every four turns.
      void Sage.move(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point playerLocation)
      Moves in the same way as the Elf.
      void Knight.move(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point playerLocation)
      The Knight tries to moves in the following order, stopping when it can move to a valid location: 1) Tries to move one space left.
      void GamePiece.movePiece(int x, int y, Drawable[][] pieces)
      This method changes the location of the piece on the board, and changes where it will actually be drawn.
      void GamePiece.setLocation(Drawable[][] pieces, java.awt.Point newLocation)
      Determines if the new location trying to be passed is a valid.
